verses.verse: Now <WG1161> He was also <WG2532> saying <WG3004> to the disciples, <WG3101> "There was a certain <WG5100> rich <WG4145> man <WG444> who <WG3739> had <WG2192> a steward, <WG3623> and this <WG3778> [steward] was reported <WG1225> to him as squandering <WG1287> his possessions. <WG5225>

"And he called <WG5455> him and said <WG3004> to him, 'What <WG5101> is this <WG3778> I hear <WG191> about <WG4012> you? Give <WG591> an account <WG3056> of your stewardship, <WG3622> for you can <WG1410> no <WG3756> longer <WG2089> be steward. <WG3621>'

"And the steward <WG3623> said <WG3004> to himself, <WG1438> 'What <WG5101> shall I do, <WG4160> since <WG3754> my master <WG2962> is taking <WG851> the stewardship <WG3622> away <WG851> from me? I am <WG2480> not strong <WG2480> enough <WG2480> to dig; <WG4626> I am ashamed <WG153> to beg. <WG1871>
'I know <WG1097> what <WG5101> I shall do, <WG4160> so <WG2443> that when <WG3752> I am removed <WG3179> from the stewardship, <WG3622> they will receive <WG1209> me into their homes. <WG3624>'

"And he summoned <WG4341> each <WG1538> one <WG1520> of his master <WG2962>'s debtors, <WG5533> and he [began] saying <WG3004> to the first, <WG4413> 'How <WG4214> much <WG4214> do you owe <WG3784> my master?'

"And he said, <WG3004> 'A hundred <WG1540> measures <WG943> of oil. <WG1637>' And he said <WG3004> to him, 'Take <WG1209> your bill, <WG1121> and sit <WG2523> down <WG2523> quickly <WG5030> and write <WG1125> fifty. <WG4004>'

"Then <WG1899> he said <WG3004> to another, <WG2087> 'And how <WG4214> much <WG4214> do you owe <WG3784>?' And he said, <WG3004> 'A hundred <WG1540> measures <WG2884> of wheat. <WG4621>' He said <WG3004> to him, 'Take <WG1209> your bill, <WG1121> and write <WG1125> eighty. <WG3589>'

"And his master <WG2962> praised <WG1867> the unrighteous <WG93> steward <WG3623> because <WG3754> he had acted <WG4160> shrewdly; <WG5430> for the sons <WG5207> of this <WG3778> age <WG165> are more <WG5429> shrewd <WG5429> in relation <WG1519> to their own <WG1438> kind <WG1074> than <WG5228> the sons <WG5207> of light. <WG5457>

"And I say <WG3004> to you, make <WG4160> friends <WG5384> for yourselves <WG1438> by means <WG1537> of the mammon <WG3126> of unrighteousness; <WG93> that when <WG3752> it fails, <WG1587> they may receive <WG1209> you into the eternal <WG166> dwellings. <WG4633>

"He who is faithful <WG4103> in a very <WG1646> little <WG1646> thing <WG1646> is faithful <WG4103> also <WG2532> in much; <WG4183> and he who is unrighteous <WG94> in a very <WG1646> little <WG1646> thing <WG1646> is unrighteous <WG94> also <WG2532> in much. <WG4183>
"If <WG1487> therefore <WG3767> you have not been <WG1096> faithful <WG4103> in the [use of] unrighteous <WG94> mammon, <WG3126> who <WG5101> will entrust <WG4100> the true <WG228> [riches] to you?
"And if <WG1487> you have not been <WG1096> faithful <WG4103> in [the use of] that which is another's, who <WG5101> will give <WG1325> you that which is your own?

"No <WG3762> servant <WG3610> can <WG1410> serve <WG1398> two <WG1417> masters; <WG2962> for either <WG2228> he will hate <WG3404> the one, <WG1520> and love <WG25> the other, <WG2087> or <WG2228> else <WG2228> he will hold <WG472> to one, <WG1520> and despise <WG2706> the other. <WG2087> You cannot <WG1410> <WG3756> serve <WG1398> God <WG2316> and mammon. <WG3126>"
Now <WG1161> the Pharisees, <WG5330> who were lovers <WG5366> of money, <WG5366> were listening <WG191> to all <WG3956> these <WG3778> things, <WG3778> and they were scoffing <WG1592> at Him.

And He said <WG3004> to them, "You are those <WG3588> who justify <WG1344> yourselves <WG1438> in the sight <WG1799> of men, <WG444> but God <WG2316> knows <WG1097> your hearts; <WG2588> for that which is highly <WG5308> esteemed <WG5308> among <WG1722> men <WG444> is detestable <WG946> in the sight <WG1799> of God. <WG2316>

"The Law <WG3551> and the Prophets <WG4396> [were proclaimed] until <WG3360> John; <WG2491> since <WG575> then <WG5119> the gospel <WG2097> of the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is preached, <WG2097> and everyone <WG3956> is forcing <WG971> his way <WG971> into it.

"But it is easier <WG2123> for heaven <WG3772> and earth <WG1093> to pass <WG3928> away <WG3928> than <WG2228> for one <WG1520> stroke <WG2762> of a letter <WG2762> of the Law <WG3551> to fail. <WG4098>

"Everyone <WG3956> who divorces <WG630> his wife <WG1135> and marries <WG1060> another <WG2087> commits <WG3431> adultery; <WG3431> and he who marries <WG1060> one who is divorced <WG630> from a husband <WG435> commits <WG3431> adultery. <WG3431>

"Now <WG1161> there was a certain <WG5100> rich <WG4145> man, <WG444> and he habitually dressed <WG1737> in purple <WG4209> and fine <WG1040> linen, <WG1040> gaily <WG2165> living <WG2165> in splendor <WG2988> every <WG2596> day. <WG2250>
"And a certain <WG5100> poor <WG4434> man <WG4434> named <WG3686> Lazarus <WG2976> was laid <WG906> at his gate, <WG4440> covered <WG1669> with sores, <WG1669>

and longing <WG1937> to be fed <WG5526> with the [crumbs] which were falling <WG4098> from the rich <WG4145> man's table; <WG5132> besides, <WG235> even <WG2532> the dogs <WG2965> were coming <WG2064> and licking <WG7078> his sores. <WG1668>

"Now <WG1161> it came <WG1096> about that the poor <WG4434> man <WG4434> died <WG599> and he was carried <WG667> away <WG667> by the angels <WG32> to Abraham's bosom; <WG2859> and the rich <WG4145> man <WG4145> also <WG2532> died <WG599> and was buried. <WG2290>

"And in Hades <WG86> he lifted <WG1869> up his eyes, <WG3788> being <WG5225> in torment, <WG931> and saw <WG3708> Abraham <WG11> far <WG3113> away, <WG575> <WG3113> and Lazarus <WG2976> in his bosom. <WG2859>

"And he cried <WG5455> out and said, <WG3004> 'Father <WG3962> Abraham, <WG11> have <WG1653> mercy <WG1653> on me, and send <WG3992> Lazarus, <WG2976> that he may dip <WG911> the tip <WG206> of his finger <WG1147> in water <WG5204> and cool <WG2711> off my tongue; <WG1100> for I am <WG3600> in agony <WG3600> in this <WG3778> flame. <WG5395>'

"But Abraham <WG11> said, <WG3004> 'Child, <WG5043> remember <WG3403> that during <WG1722> your life <WG2222> you received <WG618> your good <WG18> things, <WG18> and likewise <WG3668> Lazarus <WG2976> bad <WG2556> things; <WG2556> but now <WG3568> he is being comforted <WG3870> here, <WG5602> and you are in agony. <WG3600>

'And besides <WG1722> all <WG3956> this, <WG3778> between <WG3342> us and you there is a great <WG3173> chasm <WG5490> fixed, <WG4741> in order <WG3704> that those <WG3588> who wish <WG2309> to come <WG1224> over <WG1224> from here <WG7071> to you may not be able, <WG1410> and [that] none <WG3366> may cross <WG1276> over <WG1276> from there <WG1564> to us.'
"And he said, <WG3004> 'Then <WG3767> I beg <WG2065> you, Father, <WG3962> that you send <WG3992> him to my father's house <WG3624> –
for I have <WG2192> five <WG4002> brothers <WG80> – that he may warn <WG1263> them, lest <WG2443> <WG3361> they also <WG2532> come <WG2064> to this <WG3778> place <WG5117> of torment. <WG931>'
"But Abraham <WG11> said, <WG3004> 'They have <WG2192> Moses <WG3475> and the Prophets; <WG4396> let them hear <WG191> them.'
"But he said, <WG3004> 'No, <WG3780> Father <WG3962> Abraham, <WG11> but if <WG1437> someone <WG5100> goes <WG4198> to them from the dead, <WG3498> they will repent! <WG3340>'

"But he said <WG3004> to him, 'If <WG1487> they do not listen <WG191> to Moses <WG3475> and the Prophets, <WG4396> neither <WG3761> will they be persuaded <WG3982> if <WG1437> someone <WG5100> rises <WG450> from the dead. <WG3498>'"
